descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Brian Grant had 16 points and 10 rebounds as the Miami Heat overcame the absence of Eddie Jones and held off the road-weary Phoenix Suns for a 92-85 victory on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Suns fall as Stoudemire misses fourth with toe injury
article.linkText: Heat deal surprising loss to road-weary Suns
article.story:
MIAMI (AP) -- Minus their top scorer, the Miami Heat turned to Brian Grant -- bad thumb and all. Grant had 16 points and 10 rebounds as the Heat overcame the absence of Eddie Jones and held off the road-weary Phoenix Suns 92-85 Wednesday night. Grant, playing with a sprained right thumb, led a balanced attack to help offset the loss of Jones, who missed the game because of the flu. Caron Butler added 13 points and Malik Allen 12 to help the Heat win for the fifth time in their last six home games. Grant wore a bandage on his right hand to help protect a sprained thumb. "It's getting better. I got grabbed a couple times,'' Grant said. "It's painful to get grabbed on, but that's just going to happen. It isn't torn or anything, so I'm going to be out there.'' The Heat's bench also provided a spark, with Mike James scoring 15 points and LaPhonso Ellis adding 10. "You don't lose many games when you have five guys score in double figures,'' said Heat guard Eddie House, who just missed reaching double figures, finishing with nine points. Without Jones, who had returned last weekend after missing seven straight games with a sprained ankle, the Heat were looking for a spark. Grant stepped up, knocking down seven of nine shots from the floor and also adding three blocked shots in his 32 minutes. "He brings it every night,'' Miami coach Pat Riley said. "I've always felt that he's one of the best defensive big men in the league, not only in the conference. He's a little bit undersized at times, but he gives great effort.'' The Suns tied the game in the fourth quarter after falling behind by 13 points in the third quarter, but they couldn't make enough key plays down the stretch and wound up dropping their fifth straight on the road. "We can't continue to dig holes and then expect to make a comeback,'' Suns coach Frank Johnson said. "This is a disappointing loss. Brian Grant was just an animal again to us. He was sealing us in; the tone was set early. We came out loose and careless with the ball.'' Shawn Marion led the Suns with 27 points to go along with nine rebounds. Stephon Marbury, who averaged 32.4 points in his previous five games, had 18 points on 6-of-17 shooting. Rookie Amare Stoudemire sat out the fourth quarter after aggravating a big right toe injury late in the third quarter. The Heat opened a 53-42 lead at halftime and led 71-60 entering the fourth quarter. Phoenix opened the fourth with a 6-0 run, getting a pair of baskets from Joe Johnson and a fast-break layup by Marion to cut the gap to 71-66. Jake Voskuhl tied the game for the Suns with a baseline jumper, but the Heat ran off six straight points, capped by House's jumper, for an 80-74 lead. Jacobsen hit another 3-pointer, and Marbury knocked down a jumper to cut Miami's lead to 80-79 with 4:06 left. Allen's short hook shot provided an 86-82 Heat lead with 1:29 to go. Marbury dropped in a 3-pointer to cut it to 88-85 with 16 seconds left, but House put the game out of reach with a pair of free throws. "We should never have been in this situation,'' Marion said. "If we had played in the first half the way we played in the second half, we would have won, or at least have been in a position to win. We need to find a way to get some wins on the road.''

Game notes
The Heat began the night 14-27, exactly the same record they had at the halfway mark a year ago. ...The Heat won for only the third time in their last 11 overall ...Miami completed a season sweep of Phoenix. The Heat defeated the Suns 100-90 in overtime on Dec. 2. ... Despite the defeat, the Suns are 11-4 against Eastern Conference teams this season.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
